Title: US slaps sanctions on Russian Zvezda shipyard in latest blow to Arctic LNG 2’s start-up
Description: The US continues to target Russia’s LNG sector with sanctions, with the Zvezda shipyard constructing 15 ice-breaking LNG vessels for Novatek’s 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 plant as one of the latest targets of the US’s sanctions row against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Author: JS

Title: Pembina delays Cedar LNG FID to mid-2024
Description: Canadian midstream company Pembina Pipeline Corp said that it expects to take a final investment decision (FID) on its proposed 3 mtpa Cedar LNG plant in Kitimat, British Columbia by the middle of this year, which is a delay from the previous target of early 2024.
Author: JS

Title: Alexandroupolis LNG commissioning operations still underway
Description: Terminal operator Gastrade said that commissioning operations at the 4 mtpa Alexandrouplois LNG import terminal in Greece are still in ongoing following the delivery of a commissioning cargo to the facility last week.
Author: JS

Title: Energos Celsius FSRU arrives at port of deployment at Brazil’s Celba LNG terminal
Description: The 160,000 m3 Energos Celsius has arrived in Barcarena, Brazil’s north-eastern Para state, where it will be deployed as a floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) at developer New Fortress Energy’s 6 mtpa Celba import terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Woodside agrees to sell 15% stake in Scarborough JV, LNG supplies to Jera
Description: Australian independent energy firm Woodside has signed a deal to sell a 15.1% stake in its Scarborough joint venture to Japan’s Jera for $1.4 billion, expanding Japan’s involvement in the Western Australian gas project that will provide a new source of feed gas supplies to support the expansion of the 4.9 mtpa Pluto LNG.
Author: CK

Title: Cheniere targets first LNG output from Corpus Christi Stage 3 at the end of this year
Description: US LNG project developer Cheniere expects to start producing LNG from the first of seven trains at its 10 mtpa Corpus Christi LNG Stage 3 project in Texas at the end of this year.
Author: CK

Title: UK adds Arctic LNG 2 to its sanctions list;  marks second year of Russia’s war with Ukraine
Description: The UK has added the 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG 2 project in Russia and individuals linked to the project to its sanctions list with the aim of   cutting off critical funding for Russia’s war on Ukraine.
Author: CK

Title: Vitol, EOG Resources sign 10-year US gas supply deal linked to Brent pricing
Description: Global energy trader Vitol has signed a deal to buy 180,000 mmBtu of gas a day over 10 years from US oil and gas producer EOG Resources, with the bulk of the supply indexed to the Brent crude price.
Author: CK
